channel.title: Brent Saylor on Cottenie Lab
channel.description: Recent content in Brent Saylor on Cottenie Lab

item.title: What is ecology, and evolution - the value of interdisciplinary collaboration?
item.description: What is ecology? What is evolution? Seems like a really simple question from an ecology or evolution perspective, until you bring a different field into the mix, e.g., transposon/genome biology. When we started the TE (formerly known as genome) ecology group, sometimes in March 2010, I had no idea we would end here, with a publication in a journal with a higher impact factor than Ecology. Our starting point for this publication was the appeal of using ecological theory to explore the dynamics of transposable elements in the genome.

item.title: Introducing Brent Saylor - or genome (TE) ecology
item.description: Brent Saylor recently joined the lab, and this piece from At Guelph provides a nice introduction of some of the general themes he will explore for his PhD work.
